name: calcined clay production | calcined clay | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/21472/documentation

This dataset represents the production of calcined clay, a pozzolanic material used in cement production.;Calcined clay is produced by grinding and heating of natural clay between 500°C and 900°C. This thermal treatment (activation) converts crystalline clay materials to amorphous alumino silicates (Barger et al., 2001). When added to cement, amorphous silica reacts with calcium hydroxide formed during calcium silicate hydration from cement, forming C-S-H (hydrated calcium silicate). Secondary reactions may occur due to the reactive alumina content of calcined clay, forming also C-A-H (hydrated calcium aluminate) (Silva, 2007).;The addition of calcined clay to cement result in higher sulphate-resistance of the hydrated paste and in low permeability of the cementitious matrix, thus increasing the durability of cementitious products (Barger et al., 2001). ;This dataset is based on key process parameters informed by one cement manufacturer in Brazil, namely electricity consumption and fuel consumption (petroleum coke) for grinding and calcination operations. Air emissions are modelled based on emission factors from IPCC. Although simplified and with an unknown representativeness, this dataset illustrates the production process of calcined clay in Brazil.;Barger, G. S. et al. Production and use of calcined natural pozzolans in concrete. Cement, concrete and aggregates, v. 23, n. 2, 2001, pp. 73-80;Silva, M. G. Cimentos Portland com adições minerais (Portland cement with mineral additions). In. Materiais de Construção Civil e Princípios de Ciência e Engenharia dos Materiais, ed. Isaia, G. C. São Paulo: IBRACON, 2007. pp. 761-794.

From reception of fuels and clay from the clay pit - quarying operations not included.

The activity included the grinding and calcination of clay and ends with calcined clay ready to be shipped. Particulate emission is not considered due to lack of data. Infrastructure and administration not included due to lack of data.
category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2399:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Time period starts in 2015 as data refer to this year.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: This dataset is a copy of the corresponding BR dataset. Uncertainty has been adjusted accordingly.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Current technology for calcined clay production in Brazil.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset is created as copy of the corresponding regional BR dataset.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription:
Data were provided by one Brazilian cement manufacturer who also produces calcined clay for its own consumption.
Clay humidity, thermal energy consumption and electrity consumption were informed per tons of calcined clay produced.
IPCC net heating value and greenhouse gases emission for petroleum coke were used to calculate fuel consumption in terms of mass and corresponding air emissions from combustion. Water emissions to air were estimated based on clay humidity informed by the manufacturer.
Air emissions other than greenhouse gases, including particulates, were not estimated due to lack of data. For the same reason, administration and infrastructure are not included.
Uncertainty was estimated using default basic uncertainty values and Pedigree scores.
The amounts of the exchanges were calculated as described. No conversion to the geometric mean of the lognormal distribution was done, for consistency reasons with other ecoinvent datasets.

exchanges.description: Calcined clay for use as supplementary cementitious material (SCM).

flow.category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2399:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products n.e.c.
